intro: Bathiaea, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. Bathiaea species are typically evergreen and thrive in humid, well-drained soil. They are popular as houseplants due to their ability to bloom year-round under proper care. The genus includes several species, with Bathiaea ramosissima being one of the most commonly cultivated varieties.
